questions.question: What is a balanced search tree and how does it differ from a binary search tree?
options: A balanced search tree maintains minimal height for efficient operations, while a binary search tree does not guarantee balance
Both are the same
A balanced search tree stores only even numbers
A binary search tree is always balanced

questions.question: Can a binary search tree be empty?
options: Yes, it can be empty when it has no nodes
No, it must always have at least one node
Yes, but only if it has a root node with null value
No, a tree cannot be empty

questions.question: What are self-balancing binary search trees?

Binary search trees with duplicate elements
Trees that balance based on node weight
Trees that do not require balancing
